body.p: To his Excellency the Governor of the Com"lth of Kentucky

Your petitioner Lewis Bucher respectfully showeth that at the Agust Term of the Rockcastle Circuit Court 1862 that he confessed Jud"t for $20 + cost upon an Indict agst him for for keeping a Tipling house. He states that the offense if any, was committed under the following circumstances: he lived on the Wilderness & Turnpike road between Craborchard & Mt Vernon & had some spirits which he sold to neighbors by the half gallon having a small store.. but where the armies passed the road they compelled me to let them have it in such quanities as they desired. & for this he was indicted. he is poor but and a Loyal man out & out. This only by the way however: under the circumstances he prays a remission of the fine
I hope that you will remit the foregoing fine
over govr } Judge of the 12th Judicial Dist of Ky

Your message is well recd here & considered a very able Document I hope the Legislature will carry out its suggestion & prior examples -- Such passing comming from such sources is what will sustain this government agst usurpation as well as rebellion --
Send the remission (if granted to me.
My respects our Senator & Representative Wm Gillis & Bachelor
